intro: Vernonanthura montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidense Vernonanthura, is a flowering plant native to Uruguay. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
